1.title: Lion King
1.intro: This movie is about a young lion who has to learn how to be king of the animals
1.q01: What do you know about lions? (3 things)
1.q02: In general, how should fathers help their sons? (3 things)
1.description: In this scene, Mufusa is giving advice to Simba about being king someday.
1.q11: Do you think Simba is excited about being king? Why?
1.q12: Why do you think Mufasa chooses this time to talk to Simba about being king?
1.q23: Which part is the one Simba should never go to?

script.1: Mufasa: Look, Simba. Everything the light touches is our kingdom.
script.2: Simba: Wow.
script.3: Mufasa: A king`s time as ruler rises and falls like the sun. One day, Simba, the sun will set on my time here, and will rise with you as the new king.
script.4: Simba: And this will all be mine?
script.5: Mufasa: Everything.
script.6: Simba: Everything the light touches... What about that shadowy place?
script.7: Mufasa: That`s beyond our borders. You must never go there, Simba.
script.8: Simba: But I thought a king can do whatever he wants.
script.9: Mufasa: Oh, there`s more to being king than getting your way all the time.
script.10: Simba: There`s more?
script.11: Mufasa: Simba.

1.q: Which countries have borders with Taiwan?

2.q: If a kingdom is ruled by a king, what is it called when a queen rules?

3.q: How do some young kids `get there way` all the time?

2.title: Gifted
2.intro: This movie is about a gifted young girl who is raised by her uncle. Her grandmother wants to take her away, but Frank wants her to have a normal life.
2.q01: What are some reasons for children hating school ?
2.q02: How do you think genius students probably feel in school?
2.description: Mary is a genius child who doesn't want to school. In this scene, she tries to convince her father that she shouldn't go to school.
2.q11: Why is Mary hiding in her room?
2.q12: Based on the clip, do you think Mary has ever been to school before? Why?
2.q21: How does Frank describe the breakfast?
2.q22: What does Mary think she looks like?
2.q23: What does the uncle do for a job?

script.1: Frank: Made you special breakfast.
script.2: Mary: You can't cook
script.3: Frank: Hey, Mary, open up. You look beautiful.
script.4: Mary: I look like a Disney character.
script.5: Mary: Where's the special?
script.6: Frank: What?
script.7: Mary: You said you made me a special breakfast.
script.8: Mary: Please, don't make me go. You can keep home schooling me.
script.9: Frank: I've taught you everything I know.
script.10: Mary: But I don't want to go.
script.11: Frank: Well... I don't want to go to work, but I do.
script.12: Mary: You don't go to work. You fix boats on the dock.
script.13: Frank: Okay, it's a poor example, but you are still going.
script.14: Mary: But... But what about Fred?
script.16: Mary: You won't take care of him. You don't like cats.
script.17: Frank: I don't like two-eyed cats. Fred is as you know, monocular.
script.18: Mary: Who's gonna throw him his ping pong ball?
script.19: Frank: Fred's gonna be fine, no more argument,  okay? We've discussed this ad nauseam.
script.21: Frank: Oh You don't know? Looks like someone needs  school.

1.q: What Disney character do you think Mary looks like?

2.q: What are the benefits of home-schooling a child?

3.q: What is something you have done ad nauseum? (repeated and annoying)

3.title: Jobs
3.intro: This movie shows the early life of Apple CEO, Steve Jobs. How he started the company and developed the Apple vision.
3.q01: What do you know about Steve Jobs?
3.q02: What things do people negotiate about?
3.description: In this scene, the young Steve Jobs is negotiating with an electronics store.
3.q11: Do you think they have met before? Why do you think so?
3.q12: Do you think Steve is selling or buying computers? Why do you think so?
3.q21: Where has jobs been looking for buyers? "All over the _____"

script.1: So what kind of investment are we talking about here?
script.2: Jesus, Steve. I said I was interested, not buying.
script.3: I know. But you're also not the only interested party.
script.4: Oh, really? I'm not'?
script.5: No. You're not.
script.6: Hmm. That's interesting. Because it sure seemed that way the other night at Homebrew.
script.7: You think that's the first stop that we made?
script.8: We've been all over The Valley.
script.9: 0h, well, then you already have a retailer.
script.10: I got offers.
script.11: Look, Paul. My middle name's Paul. My dad's name is Paul.
script.12: Bunch of Pauls. I think we're kindred spirits here. We're both businessmen that operate from our gut. And my gut tells me to give you this opportunity.
script.13: I'm thinking $400 per machine, for 50 units, paid at the time of delivery.
script.14: $400 for a hundred units, a third up front.

1.q: Where are is the best retailer selection in Taipei?

2.q: What do kindred spirits have in common?

3.q: When should you "trust your gut"?

4.title: The Intern
4.intro: Ben is retiree who wants to keep working so he becomes a senior intern at a fashion agency and he gets on pretty well with his younger coworkers.
4.q01: Why do some people want to work after they retire?
4.q02: Do your parents/grandparents use social media? What do they use?
4.description: In this clip, Ben and Jules are discussing social media.
4.q11: Why does Jules need to take a photo for Ben?
4.q12: Do you think Ben is good at using social media?
4.q21: Why does Ben think that Jules inspires him?
4.q22: Which kind of 'views' are mentioned for setting up the profile?
4.q23:
Which famous person first said this quote: “You’re never wrong to do the right thing.”?
Mark Zuckerberg
Mark Twain 
Mark Wahlberg

script.1: So you're on Facebook, huh?
script.2: Well, I've been trying to figure it out. I joined about 10 minutes ago.
script.3: Well, better late than never. Do you want some help?
script.4: I'd love some, but, really, you've got better things to do.
script.5: No. I need a diversion.
script.6: You have a photo of yourself?
script.7: No. I need one?
script.8: Uh, if you wanna look up all those hotties from high school, you do. Say cheese.
script.9: Cheese.
script.10: That’s cute. Okay, I just need to send that to you.
script.11:
Uh... All right, so there are all these
questions for your profile that you can answer 
if you want to or not. Like religious views, political views, people who inspire you.
script.12: Jules Ostin. I'm not trying to brown-nose you, but I've been in business a long time and I've never run across anyone quite like you.  You do inspire, Jules.
script.13: I just knew, at the end of the day, that a woman with a glass of wine and a laptop had real shopping potential. You have a favorite quote?
script.14: I do. "You're never wrong to do the right thing."
script.16: Yeah. But I'm pretty sure Mark Twain said it first.

1.q: Why is it a bad idea to look up your ex on facebook?

2.q: How do people 'brown-nose' their boss?

3.q: When do you sometimes need a diversion?

script.1: Aliens: A stranger! From the outside! Oo-o-o-o-o-o...

script.3: Aliens: Tell us! What is it like outside?

script.8: Sid: Hey, bozo, you got a brain in there? Ha-ha, take that!
script.9: Woody: Oh, no! Sid!
script.10: Woody: Get down!

script.12: Woody: YOU are the one that decided to climb into this --

7.title: Forrest Gump
7.intro: This movie is taking about a man named Forrest Gump who is not smart. His life is full of interesting experiences.
7.q01: What do you know about low intelligent person?
7.q02: In general, how could we help low intelligent person?
7.description: Jenny is walking away and Forrest tries to grab her because he wants to help her, but Jenny doesn't want to listen to him.
7.q11: Does Jenny want to stay with Forrest? How do you know?
7.q12: What did Jenny do to let Forrest think she wants to hurt herself?
7.q21: According to Jenny, what is something Forrest doesn't know?

7.q23: Which country does Forrest say he will go to when he is talking with Jenny?

script.1: J: You can't keep doing this, Forrest. You can't keep trying to rescue me all the time.
script.2: F: They was trying to grab you.
script.3: J: A lot of people try to grab me. You can't keep doing this all the time.
script.4: F: I can't help it. I love you.
script.5: J: Forrest! You don't know what love is. You remember that time we prayed, Forrest? We prayed for God to turn me into a bird so I could fly far away.
script.6: F: Yes, I do.
script.7: J: You think I could fly off this bridge?
script.8: F: What do you mean, Jenny?
script.9: J: Nothing. I gotta get out of here.
script.10: F: Wait, Jenny.
script.11: J: Forrest, you stay away for me, OK? Just stay away for me, please. Can I have a ride?
script.15: F: So bye-bye, Jenny. They sending me to Vietnam. It's this whole other country.
script.16: J: Just hang on a minute. Listen, you promise me something, OK? Just if you're ever in trouble, don't be brave. You just run, OK? Just run away.
script.17: F: OK.Jenny,I'll write you all the time

8.title: Jobs Firing
8.intro: The movie is about the life of Steve Jobs and his strong and impactful character.
8.q01: What should you do when your boss is angry?
8.q02: How can Apple make their products better?
8.description: Jobs is leading the software team he gets very angry with one of the employees
8.q11: Why do you think Jobs is angry?
8.q12: Why do you think the employee feels bad?
8.q21: How long has Jobs been asking ask for the fonts?
8.q22: According to Jobs, what is a "pressing issue"?
8.q23: According to Jobs, what is something Francis does "share"?

script.1: Jobs: Okay exactly  Now, which tab do I click on to get different font styles? How many custom typefaces are there on LisaWrite?
script.2: Bill: That's actually something that I wanted to talk to you about, Steve, is...
script.3: Jobs: I've been asking for the fonts for months.
script.4: Francis: But everything we're talking about is conceptual. And I'm sorry, but typeface, it isn't exactly a pressing issue right now.
script.5: Jobs: Everything is a pressing issue.
script.6: Jobs: If we want to make the vision for Lisa a reality, we gotta put in the hours and make something crazy.
script.7: Francis: Yeah, but we have a hard date on this software, and I'm sorry, but adding pretty fonts is not gonna change that.
script.8: Francis: Well, Bill'?
script.9: Jobs: If you don't share our enthusiasm, and care for the vision of this company...
script.10: Francis: No, no, no, no. I just, I'm not understanding...
script.11: Jobs: Get out.
script.13: Jobs: Get your shit and get out. What, wait...
script.15: Francis: What, are you gonna, you're gonna fire me?
script.16: Jobs: No! I already fired you! Why are you still here?

script.1: Andy Davis: Now, you gotta promise to take good care of these guys. They mean a lot to me.
script.2: Bonnie Anderson: My cowboy!
script.3: Andy Davis: Woody? What's he doing in there?
script.4: Bonnie Anderson: "There's a snake in my boot!"
script.5: Andy Davis: Wha...?
script.6: Woody's voice box: There's a snake in my boot!
script.7: Andy Davis: Now, Woody, he's been my pal for as long as I can remember. He's brave, like a cowboy should be. And kind. And smart.
script.8: But the thing that makes Woody special is he'll never give up on you. Ever. He'll be there for you, no matter what. You think you can take care of him for me?
script.9: Andy Davis: Okay then.
script.10: Andy Davis: Oh, no! Dr. Pork Chop's attacking the haunted bakery!
script.11: Bonnie Anderson: The ghosts are getting away!
script.13: Andy Davis: Buzz Lightyear to the rescue!

10.title: Green Book
10.intro: The film is inspired by the true story of a 1962 tour of the Deep South by pianist Don Shirley and Frank "Tony Lip" Vallelonga, who served as Shirley's driver and bodyguard.
10.q02: Have you ever taken a "road trip"? Where to?
10.description: Lip and Shirley sit in a booth eating lunch. They discuss the food and the journey will take.
10.q11: Why does Shirley asked if he wanted to be a food critic?
10.q12: How does Lip feel about going to Pittsburgh?
10.q21: Why does Lip think salt is cheating?
10.q22: When do they have to get to Pittsburgh?
10.q23: When did Lip know a guy from Pittsburgh?

script.1: DR. SHIRLEY: How was that?
script.2: LIP: Salty.
script.3: DR. SHIRLEY: Have you ever considered becoming a food critic?
script.4: LIP: No, Not really, why? Is there money in it?
script.5: DR. SHIRLEY: I'm just saying, you have a marvelous way with words when describing food. Salty! So vivid. One can almost taste it.
script.6: LIP: I'm just saying it's salty, and salt's cheating. Any cook can make things salty. But to make it taste good without the salt, with just the other flavors, that's the trick.
script.7: DR. SHIRLEY: We should really get going soon if we expect to get to Pittsburgh by dinner.
script.8: LIP: When I was in the army I know a guy from Pittsburgh, except he called it Tits-burgh, cuz he said all the women there have huge tits.
script.9: DR. SHIRLEY: That's absurd. Why would women in Pittsburgh have larger breasts than, say, women in New York?
script.10: LIP: Guess we'll find out, huh?

2.q: Which color is very vivid?

3.q: Which clothes or fashion choices do you think are absurd?

11.title: Finding Nemo
11.intro: This story is about a fish called Marlin on a journey to find his lost son with hid partner Dory

11.description: Marlin meets Dory and finds out some things about her
11.q11: Why does Marlin look so anxious?

script.1: Will you quit it?
script.2: What?
script.3: I'm trying to swim here. What, ocean ain't big enough for you?
script.4: Huh?
script.5: You got a problem, buddy? Huh? Huh? Do 'ya? Do 'ya? Do 'ya? You want a piece of me?  Yeah,ooh, I'm scared now. What?
script.6: Wait a minute..
script.7: Stop following me, okay!?
script.8: What? You're showing me which way the boat went!
script.9: A boat? Hey, I've seen a boat. It passed by not too long ago. It went this way, it went this way. Follow me!
script.10: Wait a minute, wait a minute! What is going on? You already told me which way the boat was going!
script.11: I did? Oh dear...
script.12: If this is some kind of practical joke, it's not funny! And I know funny..I'm a clown fish!
script.13: No, it's not. I know it's not. I'm so sorry. See, I suffer from short-term memory loss.
script.14: Short!-term memory loss..I don't believe this
script.15: No, it's true. I forget things almost instantly. It runs in my family..
script.16: Well I mean at least I think it does.

12.title: Frozen
12.intro: The film tells about a brave princess, accompanied by an iceman, loyal reindeer, and a living snowman. A journey to find her sister who has the power to convert any object or person into ice.
12.q01: Do you like snow, why or why not?

script.1: Anna: Ew, ew, ew, the body!
script.2:
Olaf : Wait, what am I looking at right now?
Why are you hanging off the earth like a bat?
script.3: Anna: All right, wait one second. Olaf: Thank you.
script.4: Anna: You're welcome.
script.5: Olaf: Now, I'm perfect. Anna: Well, almost.
script.6: Olaf: It was like my whole life got turned upside down.
script.7:
Anna: Oh! Too hard. I'm sorry! 
Olaf: Head rush!
script.8: Anna: I was just... Are you okay?
script.9:
Olaf: Are you kidding me? I am wonderful! I've always wanted a nose. So cute. It's like a little baby unicorn. Hey! Whoa! I love it even more.
All right, let's start this thing over. Hi, everyone. I'm Olaf. And I like warm hugs.
script.10: Anna: Olaf? That's right. Olaf.
script.11:
Olaf: And you are? 
Anna: Oh. Um...I'm Anna.
script.12: Olaf: And who's the funky-looking donkey over there?
script.14: Olaf: Uh-huh. And who's the reindeer?
script.16: Olaf: Oh, the... Oh. Okay. That makes things easier for me. Aw, look at him trying to kiss my nose. I like you, too.
script.17:
Anna: Olaf. Did Elsa build you? 
Olaf: Yeah. Why?
script.18:
Anna: Do you know where she is? 
Olaf: Yeah. Why?
script.19: Anna: Do you think you could show us the way?

M: We've only been plugged in a week.
And every day it's climb the building. Fight bugs. Climb the building. Fight more bugs.

script.2: Patrick: I will work straight through lunch so I can get home on time.
script.3: Patrick: So make sure you save a big old stinky diaper for me to change, and you can take the night off, pal.
script.4: Spongebob: Great! I'll see you at six o'clock.
script.5: Patrick: Six o'clock.
script.6: Sponge Bob: Six o'clock.
script.7: Patrick:Six o'clock.
script.8: Patrick: Oh boy, that was some party!
script.9:
Patrick: Oh hey SpongeBob. Hey Junior.
What? What?!
script.10: Spongebob: Oh nothing.
script.11: Patrick: Oh, what a relief. For a second there, I thought you were mad at me.
script.12: Spongebob: Do you remember what you said to me this morning?

15.title: Brave
15.intro: The movie is about a princess who wants to be free in her life. But her parents want her to listen to the destiny.
15.q01: What do you think perfect parents should to do for their children?
15.q02: Do you think people should get married young? why or why not?
15.description: The king and the queen arranged a betrothal gathering for Merida. In this clip, Merida and the queen had different idea about this.
15.q12: From this clip, do you think they ever talked about this matter face to face?
15.q21: What does Merida think they should "call off the gathering"?
15.q22: According to the queen, what can't we run away from?
15.q23: What was the thing Merida swore to Angus (the horse) at the end?

script.1: Q: Merida, all this work, all the time spent preparing you, schooling you, giving you everything we never had. I ask you, what do you expect us to do?
script.2: M: Call off the gathering. Would that kill them? You're the queen. You can just tell the lords the princess is not ready for this. In fact, she might not ever be ready for this, so that's that. Good day to you. We'll expect your declarations of war in the morning.
script.3: Q: I understand this must all seem unfair. Even I had reservations when I faced betrothal. But we can't just run away from who we are.
script.4: M: I don't want my life to be over. I want my freedom!
script.5: Q: But are you willing to pay the price your freedom will cost?
script.6: M: I'm not doing any of this to hurt you.
script.7: Q: If you could just try to see what I do, I do out of love.
script.8: M: But it's my life, it's…I'm just not ready.
script.9: Q: I think you'd see if you could just…
script.10: M: I think I could make you understand if you would just…
script.11: Q: Listen…
script.13: M: I swear, Angus, this isn't going to happen. Not if I have any say in it.

1.q: What kind of the gathering you may wear formal clothes?

2.q: What is the difference between betrothal and marriage?

3.q: What did you ever swear to yourself about your future?

16.title: Despicable me2
16.intro: The movie is about..... A very powerful thief father raises 3 lovely daughters and a group of evil and interesting creatures as assistants, but because he does not live with his mother, he often lacks some care. But this father always has a good idea to solve anything.
16.q01: How much help did you get from parents with school work?
16.q02: How do feel about performing in front of the class?
16.description: Dad is coaxing his daughters to sleep. At this time, his daughter needs to perform a show and he needs his father's help to give him some advice. Dad also faces some challenges.
16.q11: Do you think Gru wants to help Agnes? why or why not?
16.q12: In the end, how does Agnes feel about the show?
16.q21: Agnes says others classmates have something she doesn't have, what is that?
16.q22: What other kind of show does Gru mention?
16.q23: What does Gru want Agnes to imagine?

script.1:
GRU
          So...hugs, kisses...
          
          ...good night, sleep tight, don't
          let the bedbugs blah-blah-blah-blah-
          blah- -
script.2:
AGNES
          But you said you'd help me
          practice my part for the Mother's
          Day show!
script.3:
GRU
          Fine, fine... Let me hear it.
          Quickly.
script.4:
AGNES
               
             She kisses my boo-boos
             She braids my hair
             My mother is beyond compare
             We love you, mothers, everywhere!
script.5:
GRU
             Wow! That was...something else. I
             really liked the way you smiled at
             the end. Let's try this one more
             time, but a teensy bit less like a
             zombie, okay?
script.6:
AGNES
             Okay.
                 (still monotone)
             She kisses my boo-boos
             She braids my hair--
script.7:
GRU
             Perfect!   Time to go!
script.8:
AGNES
             I don't think I should do this.
script.9:
GRU
             Well, what do you mean?    Why not?
script.10:
AGNES
             I don't even have a mom.
script.11:
GRU
             Well, you don't need one to do the
             show. I mean, you did the Veterans
             Day Pageant and you haven't been in

script.13:

          Okay, well, then...maybe you can
          just use your imagination.
script.14:
AGNES
          You mean I pretend I have a mom?
script.15:
GRU
          Yes, right. You can do that, can't
          you?
script.16:
AGNES
          Yeah! I do that all the time!
          Thanks, Gru!

17.title: Finding Dory
17.intro: This movie is about a fish called Dory, Dory remember her parents and starts finding them, she remember her childhood memories during the journey.
17.q01: Do you like visiting aquariums? why or why not?
17.q02: What is something you often forget?
17.description: Marlin and Nemo are stuck in an aquarium, they try to escape and find Dory.
17.q11: What is Marlin trying to do when he said ”Ooo-too”?
17.q21: Why does Nemo think the bird (Becky) won't come back?
17.q22: What does Marlin think Dory would assess/analyze?

script.1: Marlin: Ooo-roo. Ooo-roo, ooo-roo. Ooo-roo. Ooo-roo. Ooo-roo. Ooo-roo. Ooo-roo, ooo-roo!
script.2: Nemo: Dad, stop. She's not coming back.
script.3: Marlin: She might. Ooo-roo, ooo-roo!
script.4: Nemo: Dad! You made her feel like she couldn't do it.
script.5: Marlin: You're not talking about Becky, are you?
script.6: Nemo: I miss Dory.
script.7: Marlin: Me too. The truth is, I'm just so worried about her.
script.8: Nemo: She's the one who should be worried about us.
script.9: Marlin: Well, she would definitely have an idea of what to do if she were here. I don't know how she does that.
script.10: Nemo: I don't think she knows, Dad. She just does.
script.11: Marlin: Well, then we'll just have to think.
script.14: Nemo: Yeah! What would Dory do?
script.15: Marlin: She would assess her situation, and then she'd evaluate...Then she would analyze her options...
script.16: Nemo: Dad, that's "What would Marlin do."
script.17: Marlin: Right, that's what I would do. She wouldn't even think twice. She would just look at the first thing she sees and...

1.q: When will you assess your situation?

2.q: What kind of Job requires a lot of analyzing?

3.q: When is it a good time to think twice before you do something?

18.title: Wonder
18.intro:
Auggie is a 10-year-old boy he has a ugly face ,
his parents decide to enroll him in a private school.  During the semester Auggie  sufferd 
from bullied  by his classmates. The movie talk about his life.
18.q01: Why do some children get bullied at the school?
18.q02: How can family help when the children are having trouble at school?
18.description: Auggie's sister invited him to Halloween party,  but he seems doesn't want to go .
18.q12: Do you think he go to the Halloween party? Why or why not?
18.q21: Who said something behind Auggie's back?
18.q22: When a person accidentally touches him at school, what did they call it?
18.q23: Why doesn't Isabel's friend like her anymore?

script.1: Come on, get ready. It's almost time for the Halloween parade.
script.2: You're supposed to knock!.....Go away!
script.3: Mom says you won't say what happened.
script.4: Did someone say something?
script.5: Someone always says something!
script.6: Well, tell me what happened.
script.7: It's none of your business!
script.8: You took my day with Mom, so it is my business.
script.9: I heard Jack Will talking about me behind my back. He said he'd kill himself if he looked like me.
script.10: Jack Will? Isn't he the nice one?
script.11: There are no nice ones! I wish I'd never gone to school in the first place!
script.12: But you were liking school. I know you were.
script.13: I hate it, okay? I hate it.
script.14: Auggie, I'm sorry, but you're not the only one who has bad days.
script.15: Bad days? Do people avoid touching you? When a person accidentally touches you, do they call it "the plague"? - No. - Jack Will was all I had.
script.16: So just don't compare your bad days at school to mine, okay?
script.18: Hey. Did you notice that Miranda doesn't come around anymore?...What?
script.19: You didn't. Shocker. Yeah. She went away to camp this summer and now she doesn't like me anymore….Why?
script.20: Because...school sucks. And people change. So if you wanna be a normal kid, Auggie, then those are the rules. So let's go trick-or-treating. Okay? Because right now… we're each other's best friends.
script.22: Yes. So... come on. I'll let you have all my Halloween candy.

1.q: What kind of the parade do we see in Taiwan?

2.q: When is a good time to use this phrase?

3.q: What kind "plague" happened in 2020?

script.3: The throne, the secret, the whole golden sham.
script.4: I agree.
script.5: don't get familiar.
script.6: I agree.
script.7: That's why I turned down the throne, but this isn't about the crown.
script.8: This is about the people and they're dying and they're you’re  people, too.
script.9: Forget it, I have
script.10: Okay
script.11: Okay
script.16: For this. Didn't see that did ya?
script.17: There... that's better. You know, go ahead. Stay here and get drunk and enslave people for that lunatic. Keep drinking. Keep hiding.
script.18: but me... I choose to run toward my problems and not away from them.

20.title: Moana
20.intro: It's about a girl who likes the ocean and want to save it.

script.1: Moana: Maui, demigod of the wind and sea, I am Moana of Motunui. You will board my boat. No. You will board my boat. Yeah. I am Moana of Motunui. You will board my...
script.2: Maui: Boat! A boat! The Gods have given me a (screams)
script.3: Moana: Maui shapeshifter demigod of the wind and sea I am Moana...
script.4: Maui: Hero of Man

script.7: Moana: I am Mo...

script.9: Moana: What? No, I came here to...
script.10: Maui: Oh, of course, of course. Yes, yes, yes, yes. Maui always has time for his fans. When you use a bird to write with, it's called tweeting. (laughs) I know, not every day you get a chance to meet your hero.
script.11: Moana: You are not my hero. And I'm not here so you can sign my oar. I'm here because you stole the heart of Te Fiti

21.title: Paw patrol
21.intro: Ryder and the pups are called to Adventure City to stop Mayor Humdinger from turning the bustling metropolis into a state of chaos.
21.q01: Do you vote in elections? Why or why not?
21.q02: What is a good quality for a security guard?
21.description: Mayor Humdinger, had recently been elected mayor. Knowing of Humdinger's infamous wrongdoings in Foggy Bottom, a dachshund named Liberty calls the team.
21.q11: Do you think Liberty (the white dog) likes the Mayor?  Why or why not?
21.q12: Why can't Liberty get in that place?
21.q23: What are Butch and Ruben arguing about?

script.1:
Marty Muckraker Reporter :
It's election day in Adventure city.
I'm Marty Muckraker, reporting live from City Square.
In a surprising twist, the leading candidate has dropped out of the race,
leaving only one name on the ticket.
Mayor Humdinger, who has just won by default.
script.2: Liberty: Mayor Humdinger.  Ugh! Just saying it makes my skin crawl.
script.3: Ruben: No dogs. By order of the new mayor.
script.4: Liberty: Excuse me?
script.5: Butch: Yeah, you heard him. No dogs.
script.6: Ruben:  He's more of a cat person. Now beat it!
script.7: Liberty:  If those are the rules, those are the rules. You gentlemen have a wonderful day.
script.8: Ruben:  Ha-ha! Did you see that? You gotta show these dogs you're the alpha.
script.9: Butch:  You're not the alpha. I'm the alpha!
script.10: Ruben: No, I'm the alpha!
script.11: Butch: No, I'm the alpha!

1.q: What is a reason do candidates sometimes drop out of elections?

2.q: Who is the mayor of New Taipei City?

3.q: Why things make your skin crawl?

22.title: Zootopia
22.intro: Zootopia is about animal city. The disappearance of animals in this city, officer Judy and her partner are looking for clues.
22.q01: What is difficult about being a police detective?
22.description: This movie shows Nick Wiled was so nervous about the crime boss coming, and why he was scared of him. In the clip, than Nick and Judy caught by polar bear
22.q11: What things did Nick sees and makes him feel afraid?
22.q21: What kind of things does Nick notice in the very beginning?
22.q23: Why doesn't Mr. Big like Nick?

script.1: Nick Wilde: Well, now, wait a minute. Polar bear fur, rat-pack music, fancy cup? I know whose car this is, we gotta go!
script.2: Judy Hopps: Why? Whose car is it?
script.3: Nick Wilde: The most feared crime boss in Tundratown. They call him Mr. Big, and he does not like me, so we gotta go!
script.4: Judy Hopps: I'm not leaving. This is a crime scene.
script.5: Nick Wilde: Well, it's gonna be an even bigger crime scene if Mr. Big finds me here, so we're leaving, right now! Oh, gah! Raymond! And is that Kevin? Long time no see! And speaking of "no see", how about you forget you saw me. Huh? For old time's sake? That's a no.
script.6: Judy Hopps: What did you do that made Mr. Big so mad at you?
script.7: Nick Wilde:  I, um... I may have sold him a very expensive wool rug that was made from the fur of a skunk'ssss... butt.
script.8: Judy Hopps: Oh, sweet cheese and crackers.

1.q: Why do some people like watching crime movies?

2.q: Why do people put rugs in their home?

3.q: When do people use this phrase?

23.title: Aladdin
23.intro: This movie follows the titular Aladdin, an Arabian street urchin, who finds a magic lamp containing a genie. He disguises himself as a wealthy prince and tries to impress the Sultan and his daughter, Princess Jasmine.
23.q01: Do you often argue with your parents? What about?
23.q02: In India marriages are sometimes arranged, why do you think they do this?
23.description: Sultan is trying to talk Jasmine into a marriage that she isn't interested in.
23.q11: Why doesn't Jasmine want to be married?
23.q12: What is difficult about being a princess?
23.q22: How many days until she must be married?
23.q23: Sultan wants Jasmine to be married because of the law and one other reason. What is it?

script.1: SULTAN: Jasmine!  Jasmine!
script.2: SULTAN: Confound it, Rajah!  So, this is why Prince Achmed stormed out!
script.3:
JASMINE: Oh, father. Rajah was just playing with him, weren't you Rajah.
You were just playing with that overdressed, self-absorbed Prince Achmed, weren't you?Ahem.
script.4: SULTAN:  Dearest, you've got to stop rejecting every suitor that comes to call. The law says you
script.5:
(BOTH)must be married to a prince.
SULTAN: By your next birthday.
script.6: JASMINE: The law is wrong.
script.7: SULTAN: You've only got three more days!
script.8: JASMINE: Father, I hate being forced into this. If I do marry, I want it to be for love.
script.9: SULTAN: Jasmine, it's not only this law. I'm not going to be around forever, and I just want to make sure you're taken care of, provided for.
script.10: JASMINE: Please. Try to understand. I've never done a thing on my own.
script.11: JASMINE: I've never had any real friends.
script.12:
JASMINE: Except you, Rajah.
I've never even been outside the palace walls.
script.13: SULTAN:  But Jasmine, you're a princess.
script.14: JASMINE: Then maybe I don't want to be a princess.
script.15: SULTAN: Oooohhh!  Allah forbid you should have any daughters!

1.q: Have your parents ever stormed out?

2.q: Do you know someone who is self-absorbed?

3.q: What does your parents forbid you from?
